item.title: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
item.description:
ğŸš€ What Is CI/CD?

CI/CD (Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment) is a practice of automating stages in the software development lifecycle, including build, test, and delivery. It is a cornerstone of the DevOps methodology, aimed at delivering updates quickly and reliably to users.

ğŸ” Continuous Integration (CI)

Continuous Integration means regularly merging code changes into the main branch, followed by automatic checks:

  • Developers commit to the shared repository daily or more frequently;
  • The CI system runs automated tests and builds;
  • Errors are detected early, reducing the cost of fixing them;
  • Code quality improves and teamwork becomes smoother.

Popular tools: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, CircleCI.

ğŸšš Continuous Deployment (CD)

Continuous Deployment extends CI by automatically pushing tested code to a live environment:

  • After successful CI, changes are published to staging or production;
  • Time between development and feature release is minimized;
  • The manual release phase is eliminated, reducing human error risks.

A variant â€” Continuous Delivery â€” involves manual approval before final deployment.

CI/CD is applied across many development areas:

  • Microservices architectures;
  • Mobile app development;
  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC);
